results.title: Monarch butterfly story
results.brief_description: Portrays the four stages in the life cycle of the Monarch butterfly. Close-up photography depicts the Monarch laying its eggs, and shows the caterpillar eating its way out of the egg, feeding, moulting, forming its chrysalis, and emerging as a butterfly.

results.title: Mona Lisa descending a staircase
results.creator_credit: Pyramid Film and Video, American Film Institute, National Endowment for the Arts and Joan C. Gratz
results.brief_description: Using the innovative technique of clay painting, artist and filmmaker Joan Gratz takes the viewer on an entertaining and colourful journey through the development of Modern Art. Starting with the brilliant landscapes and haunting self-portraits of impressionism, “Mona Lisa descending a staircase” moves through cubism and surrealism, then finishes with vibrant images of contemporary pop art and hyper-realism. Featuring some 55 paintings and 35 artists from Van Gogh to Warhol, the video shifts seamlessly from image to image to make this artistic presentation as emotionally gripping as it is visually fascinating.

results.title: Mon homme
results.creator_credit: Les Films Alain Sarde, Plateau A, Studio Images 2, Canal+, Alain Sarde and Bertrand Blier
results.brief_description: This darkly humorous, erotic drama centres on Marie, an independent prostitute with a heart of gold. After rescuing a down-and-out homeless man one night, she falls in love with him and invites him to be her pimp. Soon he starts recruiting other women - the inexperience of one of the new recruits landing them all in jail. Discovering her lover’s duplicity, Marie decides to reform. In French with English subtitles. Cast includes Anouk Grinberg, Gerard Lanvin, Valeria Bruni-Tedeschi and Olivier Martinez. Winner of the Silver Bear Best Actress award at the Berlin Film Festival 1996.

results.title: Momotaro, the peach boy
results.brief_description: Japanese animated puppet version of a fairy story. An old couple find a baby boy in a peach and bring him up as their own son. He becomes the strongest boy in the village, and is able to save some villagers who are kidnapped by demons.

results.title: Momma don't allow
results.creator_credit: BFI, Karel Reisz and Tony Richardson
results.brief_description: One of the ‘Free Cinema’ films produced with the assistance of the British Film Institute Experimental Production Fund, established to encourage the production of films of an experimental or original nature. It was photographed on nine Saturday evenings at Art and Viv Sanders’ ‘Wood Green Jazz Club’ in ‘The Fishmonger’s Arms’. It was shot with the co-operation of the club’s members and was made cheaply on 16mm film with single-track sound transferred from tape recordings. Unhampered by sponsors, the makers of this film have been free to capture and admire the freedom, exuberance and vitality of the Jazz Club. These suburban clubs were run for and by enthusiasts; their atmosphere was not whipped up by promoters but created by the London teenagers who evolved their own free styles of dancing and created their own world of relaxation and enjoyment. Appearing in this film are members of ‘The Chris Barber Band’, Chris Barber, Pat Halcox, Lonnie Donegan, Monty Sunshine, Ron Bowden, Jim Bray and Ottilie Patterson.

results.title: Momentum: a crash course
results.creator_credit: Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education, Jim Joyce, Trish Pilley and Shane Mulcahy
results.brief_description: Uses simple collision between ice-skaters and gliders on an air track to develop the concepts of momentum and impulse and shows how these can be used in conjunction with the principles of conservation of momentim to analyse the changes in motion that occur in collisions.

results.title: Moments of the runner
results.creator_credit: Marlin Darrah Films, Runners World Magazine and Marlin Darrah
results.brief_description: Examines five of America’s most popular long-distance running competitions: Boston, New York, Chicage, Eugene and the Bay to Breakers. Includes a historical overview with scenes of Moscow, Greece, San Francisco and describes the diversity of people who take up running.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Marlin Darrah Films, Runners World Magazine and Marlin Darrah

results.title: Moments in time
results.creator_credit: Film Makers Australia, South Australian Film Corporation, Ron Lowe and Ron Saunders
results.brief_description: Museums are revealed as “time machines”, freezing moments in time so that places and things we couldn’t normally see are made available to us, to look at and to study. Their role in the study of Australian ecology and their other services are also highlighted. Commentary by Steve Curtis.

results.title: Moments in music
results.creator_credit: Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences
results.brief_description: Illustrates the range of musical talent to be found in feature motion pictures; Lily Pons, Betty Hutton, Nelson Eddy and Jeanette MacDonald, Red Skelton and Betty Garrett, Leopold Stowoski, Xavier Cugat, Rise Stevens, Bing Crosby, Harry James, Judy Garland. “All this”, the film concludes, “is brilliantly yours, at your neighbourhood theatre, when you go to the movies”.

results.title: Moment of brightness
results.creator_credit: Beaumaris Film Productions, Victorian Secondary Teachers' Association and Peter Drummond
results.brief_description: A Victorian high school teacher, Gil Freeman, tells of the problems in his present school - a typically old, poor, overcrowded, ill-equipped metropolitan high school, and his approach to teaching in this environment. He finds that teaching higher forms is only a form of cramming necessary for entrance to university or college; with younger forms he has the opportunity to experiment and acknowledge each child’s individuality. Also tells of his own background, and includes a meeting of a teachers’ association. Commentary by Bill Hannah
